title: Man With Assault Weapon Arrested in Times Square Subway Station
sub_head: Officers on patrol observed man with what appeared to be an AK-47 semiautomatic rifle
body:
An 18-year-old man carrying an assault weapon in Manhattan’s Times Square subway station was arrested Friday, New York Police Department officials said.
Officers on patrol observed the man with what appeared to be an AK-47 semiautomatic rifle at 12:30 p.m. near turnstiles in the station, according to the officials. The officers took the man into custody without incident, the officials said.
The man wasn’t identified by the officials. The gun he carried was unloaded, but the man was carrying at least one magazine with ammunition.
He was being questioned by police Friday afternoon and was expected to be charged. Police officials said the man’s motive for carrying the weapon was still unknown.
New York City has seen a rise in gun violence during the Covid-19 pandemic, particularly in areas of Brooklyn, the Bronx and Queens.
